pull_request.body:
Fixes APP-####

repo.name: rainbow
repo.description: 🌈‒ the Ethereum wallet that lives in your pocket

repo.name: rainbow
repo.description: 🌈‒ the Ethereum wallet that lives in your pocket

forkee.name: rainbow
forkee.description: 🌈‒ the Ethereum wallet that lives in your pocket

commits.message: update fns and remove some unused ones
update arc.graphql query to include priority
update provider and sheet to use @storage
add priority tag to collection query
update check for campaign to use @/storage and abstraction of check-fns to reduce boilerplate

comment.body: +1. Added a `priority` tag in Contentful and ordered by that Int.

pull_request.title: Feature: Add remote promo sheet
pull_request.body:
Fixes APP-865

## Remaining work
- [ ] primaryButtonProps navigation
- [ ] i18n (how does Contentful handle this?)
- [ ] hasNonZeroAssetBalance

## What changed (plus any additional context for devs)
Promo sheets can now be configured and deployed fully from [Contentful](contentful.com). The work on this PR can really be split up into 4 major parts.

1. [Serve Contentful data from Arc](https://github.com/rainbow-me/arc/pull/267)
2. Consume Contentful data react-query
3. Write generic check fns and remote promo sheet
4. Wrap App.js in `<RemotePromoSheetProvider />` and skedaddle.

## Screen recordings / screenshots
// TODO

## What to test
// TODO

## Things to do before merging
- [ ] Remove all static / local promo sheets
- [ ] Revert arc graphql config

Yeah this check infers two things:
1. you want the user to have a select wallet
2. that select wallet needs to not be `readonly`

comment.body:
I prefer logs to be prepended with their context, `Campaigns: no campaign to prompt` find it helps readability with the insane amount of logs we get 

if we dont need these in production than you can use `logger.debug` with a DebugContext for Campaigns so we can filter/toggle

4. Wrap App.js in `<RemotePromoSheetProvider />` and skedaddle.

pull_request.title: Feature: Add remote promo sheet
pull_request.body:
Fixes APP-865

## Remaining work
- [ ] primaryButtonProps navigation
- [ ] i18n (how does Contentful handle this?)
- [ ] hasNonZeroAssetBalance

## What changed (plus any additional context for devs)
Promo sheets can now be configured and deployed fully from [Contentful](contentful.com). The work on this PR can really be split up into 4 major parts.

1. [Serve Contentful data from Arc](https://github.com/rainbow-me/arc/pull/267)
2. Consume Contentful data react-query
3. Write generic check fns and remote promo sheet
4. Wrap App.js in `<RemotePromoSheetProvider />` and skedaddle.
